info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 1 at 12:01AM MDT until August 1 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Billings MT
info.description:
FFWBYZ
The National Weather Service in Billings has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... The Elk Burn Area in... Western Sheridan County in north central Wyoming...
* Until 300 AM MDT.
* At 1201 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Elk Burn Area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is expected. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flows. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Elk Burn Area.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and downstream of the Elk Burn Area.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Western to central sections of the Elk burn scar.
info.instruction:
Life threatening flooding of creeks, roads, and normally dry coulees in and downstream of the Elk burn area is likely. In addition to the flash flooding, the heavy rains may trigger rockslides, mudslides, and debris flows in steep terrain.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
